III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
This facility is located on 36th St. SE in Kentwood, Michigan; in the SE section of Kent
County. It was formerly the Pathfinder Resources residential program for adult women.
The facility has been totally renovated. The State Office of Fire Safety and the County
Environmental Sanitarian have approved the DART program facilities. The facility has
14 bedrooms with attached bathrooms. The living area is large with many areas for
adolescents to spread out. The kitchen and dining facilities are also large and well
furnished. The facility is in excellent repair, extensively renovated, and is very clean.
The outside recreation area of the facility is fenced, but is small and furnished with only
basic playground equipment.
B. Program Description
The DART Program [Developmental Adolescent Residential Treatment Program] is a
component of Hope Network’s residential services. It is a new facet in the continuum of
services in that it is Hope Network’s first residential program for adolescents. DART is a
co-ed, locked, long term treatment program that is designed to provide intensive
behavioral health treatment to adolescents between 12 and 17 years of age. DART
targets their services to adolescents with neurolodevelopmental conditions, autism,
mental retardation, fetal alcohol syndrome, severe learning disabilities, ADHD, genetic
and metabolic disorders, and other complex disabilities. Members of these populations
2

who exhibit mental and behavioral conditions that prevent them from community living
are appropriate candidates for residency.
The program design is for extensive assessment and treatment. Psychiatrists,
Psychologists, Neurologists, Therapists, and Medical Doctors are on staff. They will
provide a comprehensive assessment of development, cognition, personality, mental
health, relationship potential, and adaptive functioning. Kentwood Public Schools also
provides special education services that include a high ratio of teachers, aides, and
direct care staff.
Staffing ratios are between 1:2 and 1:3, with some residents receiving 1:1 staffing.
Therapist caseloads are projected to be between 5 and 8 residents, depending on
severity. Activities are individualized to the resident and off-campus resources will be
utilized when necessary. An activity therapist will assess each resident’s potential and
interests.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The facility is in compliance with all licensing rules.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of a provisional license to this child caring institution, private.
